original_query: Query 1: Whats the latest between India and Bangladesh?

summaries.text: Access denied to URL "http://www.business-standard.com/external-affairs-defence-security/news/india-curbs-key-bangladeshi-imports-via-land-ports-amid-trade-tensions-125051701298_1.html" due to lack of permission on the server. Reference #18.242a336a.1747537021.b366218, https://errors.edgesuite.net/18.242a336a.1747537021.b366218.

Recent India-Bangladesh relations include India placing curbs on Bangladesh exports (excluding fish, edible oil) to North-East and abroad (May 2025). Foreign Affairs Adviser Touhid Hossain stated Bangladesh wants good relations with India based on mutual respect and shared interests (February 2025). Border security chiefs are meeting amid fencing row (February 2025). 12 Bangladeshi fishermen were released from West Bengal jail (December 2024). MEA stated India is committed to citizen safety in Bangladesh (July 2024). Foreign Secy Kwatra met Sheikh Hasina, discussing security, water, trade, investment, power, energy, defence, and connectivity (May 2024). Teesta water-sharing talks continue (September 2022). Delhi and Dhaka signed a river pact and plan to strengthen cooperation against terrorism (September 2022). India aims to resume Bangladesh bus, rail links after Eid (April 2022). Indo-Bangla connectivity projects are expected to boost Eastern India's economy (April 2022).
